newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent weakens as public holidays thin trade.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent weakens as public holidays thin trade.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures weakened slightly on Thursday in thin volumes with most of Europe absent due to May Day public holidays, traders said.
June IPE Brent was trading 10 cents lower at $18.42 a barrel, while May gas oil was 50 cents lower at $171.75 a tonne at 1012 GMT.
"It opened in line with expectations," said one trader.
Traders attributed the losses to weakness on NYMEX overnight. June crude was seven cents off at $20.14 on ACCESS.
"We've seen a little bit of pressure, margins have narrowed but there's not really that much going on," said another trader.
The June IPE/NYMEX crude spread stood at $1.68 a barrel at 1022 GMT.
Some players said the fact June Brent had failed to fill a key downside gap up to $18.77, despite the fact it got as high as $18.75, had put of a dampener on bullish sentiment.
The May Day holiday meant many European players were absent from the market.
Gas oil was slightly lower as it consolidated recent gains and a few players took profits.
